tourName: Mongolia Tsaatan reindeer herders group tour
generalInfo:
Discover Mongolia’s Tsaatan Reindeer Herders

Journey into the remote Taiga of northern Mongolia to meet the Tsaatan reindeer herders, one of the last communities preserving this unique way of life. Living in harmony with nature, the Tsaatan rely on their reindeer for transport, milk, and companionship, maintaining traditions that have endured for centuries.

This adventure takes you beyond the usual tourist trails, deep into Mongolia’s wilderness. Explore the vast beauty of Lake Khovsgol, ride reindeer through dense forests, and experience daily life in a Tsaatan camp. Gain insight into ancient shamanistic practices and visit the Darkhad Valley, home to prehistoric deer stones and diverse ethnic cultures.

Spending time with the Tsaatan offers a rare opportunity to understand their deep connection to the land. The Mongolian Taiga remains one of the last true wildernesses, where unspoiled landscapes stretch as far as the eye can see. This journey supports sustainable tourism, ensuring the Tsaatan community benefits while preserving their nomadic traditions.

The best time to visit is between June and September when the weather is mild and the region is most accessible. Horseback riding and trekking require a moderate level of fitness, and accommodations range from ger camps to traditional Tsaatan teepees. Pack warm layers, sturdy boots, and a spirit of adventure.

Join this unforgettable experience to witness Mongolia’s reindeer herders and explore one of the most remote and fascinating regions on Earth.

dayInfo.description: Flight to Murun and visit Lake Khovsgol National Park: Take a domestic flight to Murun town and then drive to Lake Khovsgol (100km), known as “Blue Pearl”. The lake itself is one of the natural wonders of the earth and the second-largest freshwater lake in Asia. It is surrounded by magnificent pine-covered mountains. You will relax at the lakeshore and capture a multitude of stars over the blue lake. Accommodation: Tourist Ger Camp

Ulaan Uul Village: Today we head to the north and enter the beautiful Darkhad valley (210km), named after the Darkhad ethnic group who are known for their shamanic roots and practice. The valley is situated between the Taiga and Khoridol Saridag mountain ranges, home to nature and cultural diversity. We arrive at one of the three remote villages in northern Mongolia. Accommodation: Local guest house or small ger camp
Khogrog River Valley: Drive to Khogrog River valley (130km) where we meet our horse crew and set up a tent camp and stay overnight. Accommodation: Camping

Ride to the Taiga Mountains: In the morning pack up, saddle up the horses, and ride up to the Taiga Mountains to meet the Tsaatan people - reindeer herders. We will reach their tribe in the late afternoon depending on the weather and road conditions as well as the Tsaatan tribe’s campsite location. Accommodation: Teepee beside the Tsaatan tribe families

Experience the culture and lifestyle of the Tsaatan people: It’s time to experience the unique lifestyle of the remote ethnic tribe, try riding a reindeer, see and learn how they breed the reindeer, meet the Tsaatan ethnic shaman and see the shamanic rituals, and learn the mysterious stories among these ethnic people while sitting around the campfire. Accommodation: Teepee beside the Tsaatan tribe families

Back to Ulaan uul village: Time to say goodbye to the reindeer herders and ride back to Khogrog River Valley. Meet our vehicle team and drive to Ulaan Uul village. Accommodation: Local guest house or small ger camp
Murun Town: Drive back to Murun town, on the the way, we will see the deer stone statues which are the tallest in Asia. Accommodation: Local Hotel
Fly back to Ulaanbaatar: Transfer to the hotel and enjoy your time to relax after a big adventure. Accommodation: Grand Hill Hotel
Departure Day: Today you travel home or you can take the next adventure to the Mongolia Sagsai Eagle Festival!
